ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Integrals, derivatives, advanced calculus
Basic Calculus 2 knowledge, critical thinking.
Ive improved my Calculus skills.
I improved my study skills.
I gained a very rigorous understanding of basic concepts in Calculus, including integration, series, volumes and areas, etc.
call II skills
I gleaned a more conceptual understanding of calculus that I am certain will benefit me as I go into higher-level calculus courses.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Rachel was an awesome instructor! Hands down, the best math teacher that I've ever had. No real weakness in the course.

Weaknesses: explorations were pointless, problem sets were sometimes extremely tedious 

Strengths: good lecturer (Rachel), review sessions before exams were helpful
It is a good course for anyone who wants further their knowledge of Calculus, but it should be more engaging.
The way this class was set up was very organized (information about exams/units was readily available)
This was a phenomenal introduction to topics in Calculus, and the course structure prepared us well for exams
great math class, but would be much better with mastery grading system

The class was very well taught and organized. Though challenging at times, there were a lot of resources to get extra help & gain a better understanding. I wish, though, that there was more student engagement encouraged to make the class more interactive. Also, there were no pre-class assignments in the second half of the semester which made in-class time less productive. I completely support the flipped classroom, so preparing before class was really helpful and I hope the instructors can do more to promote that out-of-class learning.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Going into small breakout rooms to practice problems with classmates felt effective. It provided a low stress environment to talk through new problems and facilitated discussion more than in a large group.
Breakout rooms could be improved.
Virtual office hours were great
I feel that the COVID adaptations made for this course worked very well. My instructor did an excellent job of making virtual resources available to us.
it was the best that a math class could do virtually
It would be really good to set up study groups or encourage student interaction, which was really difficult in an online setting. Working on PSETs with other students would have helped a lot.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Would largely depend on the section leaderif Rachel, would definitely recommend it!
Not unless it is for a requirement (like your major). Bland material.
yes
Yes it was very well organized
Yes! I'm so glad I took this before taking other statistics/STEM courses. It's a great foundation in calculus for people who need the basic skills for applications.
yes, its a great math class

I would recommend this class to students who have it as a requirement. I have heard that Yale's calculus courses can be intimidating, but I loved how many helpful resources there were. The class isn't intended to trick you with impossible problems, but to really help you have a foundational understanding of calculus.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Recorded videos
The course also incorporated live office hours and recorded virtual review sessions for exams.
canvas assignments
There were also pre-class asynchronous assignments to be completed.
